Are you the best sumo?! Find out in this quirky multiplayer brawler that's a cross between Super Smash Bros. and QWOP. Duke it out and fight your way to the top!

About This Game



Is it a bird? Is it a plane? No, it's super fat guys free-styling!!!

Sumo Revise is a local-multiplayer brawler designed to harken back to the zaniness and replayability of couch-crowding games like Super Smash Bros. and GoldenEye 007, with a splash of silliness of games like QWOP and Surgeon Simulator 2013.

FEATURES


INSANE, UNPREDICTABLE GAMEPLAY
Struggle to force your friends out of the ring in lightning-fast, ever-changing rounds. Grab power-ups to learn the secret abilities of the sumo masters. Don hats and costumes on the fly to confuse your opponents (and yourself)!

EXOTIC LOCATIONS AND EXTENSIVE CUSTOMIZATION
Battle in seven different arenas in the far reaches of Sumo Land. Sharpen your skills with 12 different modes and gameplay modifiers, including Free-For-All, Capture the Flag, and Bacon. Create and share your own levels and modes for never-ending insanity!

THE PLACE IS CRAWLING WITH SUMOS!
Play with up to 8 players simultaneously, or supplement with AI opponents if you're feeling lonely.

REALISTIC SUMO PHYSICS?
Unfortunately, since they're so portly the sumos don't exactly maneuver well...Move wisely!

DISCLAIMERS

Sumo Revise is designed to be a local multiplayer game, and some of its best qualities are lost during online play. As such, Sumo Revise is at this time offline-only. BE ADVISED. Also, playing with 8 players simultaneously requires four gamepads, two keyboards, and a mouse. The extra keyboard is needed because keyboard hardware can only receive a few inputs at once. BE ADVISED.


READ MORE

System Requirements

    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP / Vista / 7 / 8 / 8.1
    • Processor: 1.4 GHz Processor
    • Memory: 512 MB RAM
    • Hard Drive: 65 MB available space
    • Sound Card: 100% DirectX compatible card or onboard sound

This is a pretty fun game its like playing Sumo super smash bros with all sorts of funny powerups and twists the music is very energizeing and fun to listen to while you play you can even craft your own levels and play them with friends i hope this game has a workshop feature someday.

Pros: Energizeing but fun soundtrack, like the sumo version of super smash brothers, very wackey pickups that put you in silly costumes or in a silly hat that has effects, ability to make your own levels and play them with friends, great for a quick and fun game,

Cons: Theres no workshop support (i hope it has it someday though

9.5/10 really a exciteing and fun game that was made with gamemaker studio

Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny
8 of 12 people (67%) found this review helpful
Insania404
114 products in account
1 review
Recommended
11.0 hrs on record
Posted: June 27
I enjoy a game that I can sit down and play with my friends and family. Normally, I tend to be competitive when it comes to games, but when it comes to this game in particular, all I experience is joy and laughter.

The entire game is ridiculously fun and extremely spontaneous. You'll be playing at normal speed on one round only to find the next round has a super splorch Special that has been waiting for you, filled to the brim with speed boosts and launch arrows.

The game doesn't end until you choose to end it, which is also a plus.

It lacks a lot of pre-made levels, but the level editor makes up for it. There's also a mod editor which I'm excited to try out, but there's a bit of learning involved.

Pros:

Really easy controls
silly costumes/skins/hats
level editor
various modes
Space Squid! :)

Cons:

lack of built in levels
Achievements are a little too easy to obtain.


Overall, I would recommend this game to someone who tends to have a lot of friends over, or to someone who has a lot of siblings that enjoy playing games. If you don't have anyone to truly share the joy and fun of the game, the AI is alright to fight with, but tends to get boring without the feedback of real people playing the game along with you.

AK-FORTY KEVIN
118 products in account
8 reviews
Recommended
1.5 hrs on record
Posted: August 16
This is a very interesting game that has abot as many pros as cons which has my desision on if it is a good game or not. I will start with the pros.

The graphics are in a very nice 8-bit form that isnt seen very often anymore.

The soundtrack is very nice and catchy, in fact I was humming it as I was writing this review.

The gameplay is very fun with a bunch of power ups to keep it interesting. You can also invite a bunch of your buddies over and they can join you


And now for the cons

The graphics can become a bit disorienting, especially if all the characters look very similar, they sometimes end up being the same color as your character. It gets really annoying.

There is a multiplayer, but it is NOT an online multiplayer, not even a local. It is not internet related at all. Which means you have to crowd a bunch of friends areound the keyboad that you likely only have one of to play this game, so you either just don' play the supposed fun multiplayer or you have to buy a few more keyboards and/or controlers

sometimes the gameplay doesn't make any sense at all, some of the power ups do nothing.



Well the way I see things a good ought weighs a bad so I am going to give this game a 7/10
